net.wstech2.me.httpsclient

Class HttpsConnectionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.wstech2.me.httpsclient.HttpsConnectionUtils

  • public class HttpsConnectionUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A collection of static, state independent, auxiliary methods to support the execution of common tasks in HttpsConnectionImpl.

      • parseDate

        public static java.util.Date parseDate(java.lang.String date)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parses a date string. Refer to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec3.html for possible date formats.
        Parameters:
        date - Date string.
        Returns:
        An java.util.Date corresponding to the string sent as parameter.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getRequestMessage

        public static java.lang.String getRequestMessage(HttpsConnectionImpl conn)
        Creates a HTTP Request Message.
        Parameters:
        conn - The HttpsConnectionImpl corresponding to the HTTP message.
        Returns:
        A HTTP Request Message.

      • readLine

      • parseStatusLine

        public static java.lang.String[] parseStatusLine(java.lang.String statusLine)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses a HTTP response status line. Refer to http://www.w3.org/Protocols/HTTP/1.0/spec.html#Status-Line
        Parameters:
        statusLine - A message status line.
        Returns:
        An array containing the response elements.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception

      • parseHeaderLine

        public static java.lang.String[] parseHeaderLine(java.lang.String line)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Parses a HTTP message header line.
        Parameters:
        line - The header line.
        Returns:
        A two-element String array containing the key name and the value of the line header.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • logError

        public static void logError(java.lang.String message,

        Uses System.err.println() to log error messages. The Throwable's message and stack trace are also logged.
